answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!This could be an abnormal perception of taste. Dry tongue can also give a salty taste. Presence of blood as in mouth ulcers, vitamin C deficiency, bleeding gums, pus in gums, and gastric reflux can cause a salty taste in mouth. Please consider a dental checkup.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

I do have extremely bad GERD ever since I was 1, I had tubes all over my face, it was bad. Could it be my tumor? or because I suddenly stoped the synthroid?

HiStopping Synthyroid or the Pituitary tumor should not cause salty taste. However you can ask the specialist you see also.You can follow some lifestyle changes: Avoid heavy meals. Avoid too much of caffeine, tea, fried food and drinks both alcoholic and non alcoholic fuzzy ones. Avoid heavy exercises within 4 hours of a heavy meal. Raise the head end of the bed by pillows to 30 degrees. Go to bet at least 2 hours after food. Maybe these tips will help you.Also if you have had severe GERD then just one drug may not help you. You may need a combination of acid reducing drugs.Ideally you should go for upper GI endoscopy. Please discuss this with your doctor. Take care!
